item.title: Covid-19: Sunak set to unveil emergency jobs scheme
item.description: The chancellor is expected to announce new measures to replace the furlough scheme which expires next month.

item.title: NHS Covid-19 app: England and Wales get smartphone contact tracing for over-16s
item.description: Users are being urged to install the app to protect themselves and others against the resurgent virus.

item.title: Breonna Taylor: Two officers shot during Louisville protests
item.description: Anger erupts over a decision to charge no-one with killing the unarmed black woman shot by police.

item.title: Covid-19: Rishi Sunak to unveil furlough replacement
item.description: Five things you need to know about the coronavirus pandemic this Thursday morning.

item.title: Sir Harold Evans: Crusading newspaper editor dies aged 92
item.description: The British-American journalist, publisher and author was best-known for his campaigns against injustice.

item.title: US election: Trump won't commit to peaceful transfer of power
item.description: The president also predicted the US election result would be determined before the Supreme Court.

item.title: Flu jabs limited due to high demand
item.description: A leading chain, facing unprecedented demand, suspends its appointment booking system.

item.title: Zayn Malik and Gigi Hadid welcome baby girl
item.description: The ex-One Direction singer shares a picture with the couple's "healthy and beautiful" daughter.

item.title: Covid-19: UK volunteers could be given virus to test vaccine
item.description: 'Human challenge trials' to test the effectiveness of possible Covid vaccines may be held in London.

item.title: Brexit: Why is it so hard to reach a deal?
item.description: Time is running out to reach a Brexit deal - what are the obstacles?

item.title: Trump on Meghan Markle: 'I'm not a fan of hers'
item.description: The US president spoke out after Prince Harry commented alongside his wife on the looming election.

item.title: The Papers: Chancellor's 'jobs lifeline to save the economy'
item.description: Thursday's papers include Rishi Sunak's plans to save jobs and anger at new restrictions.

item.title: Mental Health: 'Kindness can help save lives'
item.description: Kamilah was in a crisis when she found flowers with a note saying 'this is a gift'.

item.title: 'How Ruth Bader Ginsburg personally shaped our lives'
item.description: A plaintiff, a student and a politician speak about the late Supreme Court justice's powerful influence.

item.title: The pandemic is fuelling a surfing boom - in Ohio corn country
item.description: With beach holidays curtailed, some landlocked Midwesterners tried out the river surfing scene.

item.title: Pilot whales Tasmania: Rescuing whales in Australia's worst stranding
item.description: Nearly 400 whales have died in Australia's worst stranding. Jools Farrell told the BBC how rescuers help those still alive.

item.title: Mourinho moved by request for photo to honour journalist's father
item.description: Spurs manager Jose Mourinho agrees to take a photo with a Macedonian journalist to put at his late father's resting place.

item.title: Fitting Plymouth's history into a Â£48m box
item.description: A museum encompassing "all of Plymouth's history and culture" opens during the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Covid-19: Wedding industry reacts to latest restrictions
item.description: Wedding planners and photographers react to the latest blow to their industry.

item.title: Does BlackRock have the world's toughest rules on romance?
item.description: It's not just the flings with colleagues, BlackRock wants to know who you are dating outside the office too.

item.title: 'A stitch in time saves nine' - what does it mean?
item.description: Boris Johnson used the phrase as he announce new coronavirus rules.

item.title: Obituary: Editor famed for campaigns against injustice
item.description: A newspaper editor who became famous for his campaigning journalism.

item.title: Transracial adoption: 'I've been accused of kidnapping my white child'
item.description: How one man went from being a âstreet kidâ in Uganda, to adopting a white child in the US.

item.title: US 2020 election: The economy under Trump in six charts
item.description: President Trump claims he has been responsible for the strongest US economy ever. What do the numbers show?

item.title: Islamic State: Relatives of British hostage braced for coming trial
item.description: The sister of journalist John Cantlie, who was kidnapped in 2012, speaks of her eight-year ordeal.

item.title: Alexei Navalny: How his team found Novichok bottle evidence in Tomsk
item.description: Russia's top opposition figure has left hospital but it was his colleagues who gathered the evidence.

item.title: How much gold is there left to mine in the world?
item.description: Some experts believe we may have hit "peak gold" production in our pursuit of the precious metal.

item.title: Rwandan genocide orphan's 'miracle' WhatsApp reunion
item.description: A girl orphaned at two during the 1994 Rwandan genocide finds relatives thanks to social media.

item.title: Sex and coronavirus: What are the rules?
item.description: New measures in England mean 'established' couples can now meet up and have sex.

item.title: Havertz hat-trick sees Chelsea cruise past Barnsley
item.description: New Chelsea signing Kai Havertz scores a hat-trick as the Blues thrash Barnsley to reach the the Carabao Cup fourth round.

item.title: England cruise to 47-run win to go 2-0 up in series - report & highlights
item.description: England overcome a middle-order wobble to claim a comfortable 47-run win against West Indies in the second T20 in Derby.

item.title: Wrexham announce takeover bid - by Hollywood star Reynolds
item.description: Hollywood star Ryan Reynolds believed to be involved in a takeover bid of National League side, the club says.

item.title: Newcastle put seven past Morecambe in their biggest ever away win
item.description: Newcastle thrash 10-man Morecambe to ease into the fourth round of the Carabao Cup.

item.title: 'Together we will make a change' - Hamilton Commission members named
item.description: Lewis Hamilton vows to increase the numbers of black people in motorsport as he named a group to analyse the causes of a lack of diversity.

item.title: Brexit: Seven things changing in January and others that remain unresolved
item.description: The UK's future relationship with the EU remains uncertain - but some things will be different in 2021.

item.title: Many firms 'have not considered Brexit effect'
item.description: Only half of UK firms that trade internationally have assessed the impact of Brexit, says a business group.

item.title: 'My bank is shutting my account because of Brexit'
item.description: Thousands of British expats living in the EU have been told their bank accounts are being closed.

item.title: Brexit: All you need to know about the UK leaving the EU
item.description: A simple guide on the UK leaving the European Union.

item.title: Coronavirus: How does Covid-19 test-and-trace work?
item.description: People who have been in close contact with someone found to have Covid-19 are being traced.

item.title: Coronavirus: Could the furlough scheme be extended?
item.description: About 10 million people have accessed the scheme, which is due to close in October.

item.title: Unemployment rate: How many people are out of work?
item.description: The number of people claiming benefits has surged, but the unemployment rate has barely moved. Why?

item.title: Coronavirus: What are social distancing and self-isolation rules?
item.description: Coronavirus cases are increasing, so what are the rules on social distancing?

item.title: Coronavirus: Why are pubs closing early but not shops selling alcohol? And other questions
item.description: New restrictions are coming in across the UK. We answer some of your questions.

item.title: Coronavirus: How many people can attend a wedding?
item.description: Wedding ceremonies can now be held but the rules on who can attend vary around the UK.

item.title: UK travel restrictions: Which countries are on the UK's quarantine list?
item.description: Key holiday spots are being regularly added to the travel quarantine list as infection rates rise.

item.title: Coronavirus: Can my child go to school with a cold?
item.description: Schools are adopting measures to reduce the spread of coronavirus and keep pupils safe.

item.title: Covid rules: What are the new coronavirus restrictions?
item.description: How will the new restrictions affect work and leisure time?
